metadata.synopsis: Karlach meets Lann at MOO and he offers her three soul coins as long as she hears the stories of their souls.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Recruit Karlach as companion.2. Speak with Lann with her nearby.

17.speaker: Lann Tarv
17.text: Well. Flo didn't tell a lie. She said you'd find me, and here you are. Karlach, isn't it?

33.speaker: Karlach
33.text: Now there's a name I'd hoped never to hear again. What was Flo doing here?

42.speaker: Lann Tarv
42.text: Didn't think to quiz her about her business.

18.speaker: Karlach
18.text: Florenta the Garrotter. A cambion I knew back in Avernus.

73.speaker: Karlach
73.text: She was the closest thing I had to a friend. That said, she would've choked the life out of me if I ever turned my back on her.
73.context: NodeContext: 'What did she want anyway' is directed to the NPC

57.speaker: Karlach
57.text: That fact that she knows where I am - where I might be going - doesn't exactly delight me.
57.context: NodeContext: 'What did she want anyway' is directed to the NPC

91.speaker: Player
91.context: NodeContext: 'What did she want anyway' is directed to the NPC

89.speaker: Karlach
89.text: Maybe. Probably. I don't know. She's a half-devil. Impossible to read.

76.speaker: Player
76.text: If she rears her head, we'll handle her.
76.context: NodeContext: 'What did she want anyway' is directed to the NPC

25.speaker: Karlach
25.text: Let's hope it doesn't come to that. What did she want, anyway?
25.context: NodeContext: 'What did she want anyway' is directed to the NPC

20.speaker: Lann Tarv
20.text: She came dressed as a novice. Gave me three soul coins. Said I could sell 'em if I wanted, but if I kept 'em for you, she'd consider it a favour owed.
20.context: NodeContext: A condition before Karlach can have the soul coins

62.speaker: Karlach
62.text: Soul coins, huh? Those could come in handy.
62.context: NodeContext: A condition before Karlach can have the soul coins

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Let's have the soul coins, then.
49.context: NodeContext: A condition before Karlach can have the soul coins

3.speaker: Lann Tarv
3.text: 'Fraid they're all gone. Should've come around sooner.
3.context: NodeContext: A condition before Karlach can have the soul coins

27.speaker: Lann Tarv
27.text: You can take a look at my other wares, if you like. Won't entice Flo into my debt, but I'm always looking for wielders worthy of my stock.

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Did Flo have anything else for us?

9.speaker: Lann Tarv
9.text: A shit-eating grin. Oh, and uh. This. That's it.

77.speaker: Lann Tarv
77.text: Sure. But she did have a condition.
77.context: NodeContext: A condition before Karlach can have the soul coins

13.speaker: Lann Tarv
13.text: For every coin you take, you've got to hear the story of the soul trapped inside.

90.speaker: Karlach
90.text: There you have it. Flo came all this way just to try to make me feel like shit. Clever use of her time.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: Memorised a bunch of sad stories on her behalf, did you?
60.context: NodeContext: MAH- vur-ee. Only here so pronounce it however you want.

7.speaker: Lann Tarv
7.text: Didn't need to. Your Flo did some devil woo-woo and stuck 'em in my head. Couldn't forget now if I wanted to.
7.context: NodeContext: MAH- vur-ee. Only here so pronounce it however you want.

8.speaker: Lann Tarv
8.text: D'you want the coins or not?
8.context: NodeContext: MAH- vur-ee. Only here so pronounce it however you want.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Fine. Get on with it, then.
56.context: NodeContext: MAH- vur-ee. Only here so pronounce it however you want.

95.speaker: Lann Tarv
95.text: First coin's got the soul of a woman named Mavery.
95.context: NodeContext: MAH- vur-ee. Only here so pronounce it however you want.

65.speaker: Lann Tarv
65.text: She was born to a cruel mother and a violent father and three evil brothers, all named Baldur.
65.context: NodeContext: A bit chastened but still with a hard edge.

93.speaker: Lann Tarv
93.text: She never knew a day of love in all her life. When she was a girl of fifteen, she sold her soul to Tiamat in exchange for someone who would love her unconditionally.
93.context: NodeContext: A bit chastened but still with a hard edge.

15.speaker: Lann Tarv
15.text: She got what she asked for. A fellow named Clint, destined to be her soul mate. Struck by a cart and died a few moments after clapping eyes on our Mavery. Poor guy.
15.context: NodeContext: A bit chastened but still with a hard edge.

50.speaker: Lann Tarv
50.text: The scud of her soul is yours, now.
50.context: NodeContext: A bit chastened but still with a hard edge.

97.speaker: Karlach
97.context: NodeContext: A bit chastened but still with a hard edge.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: We'll put that coin to better use than Tiamat would've.

72.speaker: Lann Tarv
72.text: This'n has got the soul of a man named Frakes. Lived in a village near Neverwinter, hit hard by the worst hunger in a thousand years.

22.speaker: Lann Tarv
22.text: Frakes called out for help - prayed for his children to have meat to eat.

84.speaker: Lann Tarv
84.text: Zariel answered. Made old Frakes grow flesh upon flesh after flesh. His wee ones had all the meat they could stomach.

34.speaker: Karlach
34.text: He should've known. Better to die a thousand deaths than let Zariel into your life.

98.speaker: Player
98.text: We'll put his coin to good use. He'll help us rid the Realms of people like Zariel.
98.context: NodeContext: ON-geer but it's a one-off so do it your way

46.speaker: Lann Tarv
46.text: Whatever you need to tell yourself.
46.context: NodeContext: ON-geer but it's a one-off so do it your way

70.speaker: Lann Tarv
70.text: I'd tell you another, but I'm afraid those are the only coins I've got for you. You should've come around sooner while I still had all three.
70.context: NodeContext: ON-geer but it's a one-off so do it your way

61.speaker: Lann Tarv
61.text: Last one's got the soul of a little boy named Ongir. Eight years old. He liked playing in the sun with his friends. That's all I know.
61.context: NodeContext: ON-geer but it's a one-off so do it your way

12.speaker: Karlach
12.context: NodeContext: A little sadly while maintaining her tough exterior

88.speaker: Lann Tarv
88.text: That's all. Oh. And this slip of scratch.

31.speaker: Karlach
31.text: Well thanks, Flo. Hearing a bunch of desperate horror has ruined my day, which I suppose was the point.

39.speaker: Lann Tarv
39.text: You got three soul coins out of the bargain, didn't you? I'd quit whinging if I were you.

47.speaker: Lann Tarv
47.text: I did my part. That means our business is done, unless you've got actual gold to hand.

54.speaker: Lann Tarv
54.text: Better hope you can handle what I've got.

36.speaker: Lann Tarv
36.text: Better hope you can handle what I've got.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: That's absolutely vile. Unsurprising of Zariel, but vile all the same.
51.context: NodeContext: A little accusatory, emphasis on 'youre'

86.speaker: Lann Tarv
86.text: Karlach's the one set to consume his soul, I hear.
86.context: NodeContext: A little accusatory, emphasis on 'youre'

52.speaker: Lann Tarv
52.text: I'd tell you another, but I'm afraid that's the only coin I've got for you. You should've come around sooner while I still had all three.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: No - we're not playing her little game.

94.speaker: Lann Tarv
94.text: She said Karlach might say that. And she said to let her have it her own way.

40.speaker: Lann Tarv
40.text: You can take a look at the rest of my lot, if you like. Got good weapons in search of a worthy wielder.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: What do you want soul coins for?
79.context: NodeContext: Referring to why she wants to collect soul coins

24.speaker: Karlach
24.text: I'll explain later - away from prying ears. But trust me - you'll be into it.
24.context: NodeContext: Referring to why she wants to collect soul coins

29.speaker: Player
29.context: NodeContext: A little sheepish on the 'not always' since Karlach consumes soul coins

37.speaker: Karlach
37.text: Infernal currency - each one is inscribed with a soul. Usually an evil soul, but... not always.
37.context: NodeContext: A little sheepish on the 'not always' since Karlach consumes soul coins

58.speaker: Player
58.text: We shouldn't take anything offered by a devil. Too risky.
58.context: NodeContext: Player is being dismissive of her.

6.speaker: Karlach
6.text: Cambion. But you're right. Then again... they could really come in handy.
6.context: NodeContext: Player is being dismissive of her.

28.speaker: Player
28.context: NodeContext: Player is being dismissive of her.

59.speaker: Karlach
59.text: Pfft. All right. Suit yourself. Have a trade or whatever. Then let's get out of here.
59.context: NodeContext: Player is being dismissive of her.

67.speaker: Karlach
67.text: Soul coins, huh? I know this is odd, but I could make good use of those. Might as well take 'em, while they're on offer.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: What does she want with you?

82.speaker: Karlach
82.text: Nothing would surprise me. Maybe she wants to live up to her name and wrap a cord around my neck. Or maybe she just wants to say hello.

80.speaker: Karlach
80.text: I wouldn't have given her the time of day, but even I needed a laugh once in a while. And what can I say, the bitch had good jokes.

63.speaker: Lann Tarv
63.text: Enough chatter. Your friend gave me three soul coins. Said I could sell 'em if I wanted, but if I kept 'em for you, she'd consider it a favour owed.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: What did this person want with Karlach?
64.context: NodeContext: A bit put out cause the player is short-cutting an origin moment.

68.speaker: Lann Tarv
68.text: She came dressed as a novice. Gave me three soul coins. Said I could sell 'em if I wanted, but if I kept 'em for your friend, she'd consider it a favour owed.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: Enough - I want to trade, not chat.
4.context: NodeContext: A bit put out cause the player is short-cutting an origin moment.

92.speaker: Karlach
92.context: NodeContext: A bit put out cause the player is short-cutting an origin moment.

75.speaker: Lann Tarv
75.text: I've got all sorts on offer, if you're worthy of 'em.
